result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State notes prepaid restitution and thinks close to resolution. Asks for one more status. Attorney Anderson in agreement. Court sets status.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:27 AM Defendant Kayla Hazel Marie Anderson in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Kayla Hazel Marie Anderson.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State requests another status. Prepaid restitution today. Anderson agrees.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:17 AM Defendant Kayla Hazel Marie Anderson in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Kayla Hazel Marie Anderson.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Anderson received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Asks for a status conference. Court in agreement. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Arraignment scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: No contact with Victim #1 or their residence.

01:48 PM Defendant Kayla Hazel Marie Anderson in court, via video in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Craker making a special appearance. Attorney Craker received complaint, waives reading and requests preliminary hearing. State requests $1,000 cash bail and condition of no contact with Victim #1. Defendant has no prior criminal history. Attorney Craker asks for signature bond as defendant has no criminal history and non violent crime. Court questions defendant if able to post any cash bail. Defendant cannot post but her grandfather could possibly. Defendant is employed and has local family. Court orders $1,000 signature bond with condition of no contact with Victim #1 or their residence. Court reviews with defendant options of obtaining counsel and instructs defendant to apply with Public Defender's Office right away.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.
